issue.title: txt comment email notifications rendering escaped strings into email template.

labels.name: status:Unconfirmed
labels.description: Issue, usually a bug, that has not yet been validated as a confirmed problem.

issue.body:
### Issue Summary

Comment notifications sent using the updated_comments.txt template are rendering escaped comment and reply text into the email template. 

The offending code is seen here:
```
{% trans "Deleted comments:" %}{% for comment in deleted_comments %}
 - "{{ comment.text|safe }}"
{% endfor %}{% endif %}{% spaceless %}

{% endspaceless %}{% if replied_comments %}

{% trans "New replies:" %}{% for thread in replied_comments %}

  {% trans 'New replies to:' %} "{{ thread.comment.text }}"{% for reply in thread.replies %}
   - "{{ reply.text }}"{% endfor %}{% endfor %}{% endif %}
```

The bottom two lines are outputting reply.text and thread.comment.text without using the "safe" template filter resulting in the content being escaped for display to the user. You'll note that other output in the file does use the "safe" template filter, as seen above in the "Delete comments" code snippet.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enabled comment notifications on a page.
2. As one user make a comment. Be sure to include characters that would normally be escaped. e.g. < > '
3. As a second user, reply to that comment. Be sure to include characters that would normally be escaped. e.g. < > '
4. Inspect the sent email and see that these characters are escaped for presentation to the user.

### Technical details

Found on 
- Wagtail version: 4.1.9 - appears, from the code, to be a problem on latest Wagtail versions also.

comment.body: Thanks for the detailed report @richie-blake! Tagging as a good first issue.

Found on

issue.title: Page edit footer menu shows always "unsaved changed"
issue.body: Found a bug? Please fill out the sections below. 👍 ### Issue Summary While editing any page the (new) unsaved message always shows up. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Edit any page 2. Focus on any field 3. Wait x seconds ### Technical details * Wagtail version: `2.13` Page class in question: ``` class FormPageSubmission(AbstractEmailSubscriptionFormSubmission): def handle_email_subscription_submission(self): handle_form_submission.delay(form_submission_id=self.pk) class FormPage(AbstractPage, AbstractEmailSubscriptionForm): FORM_FIELD = "page" header = StreamField(FORM_PAGE_HEADER_BLOCKS, null=True, blank=True, max_num=1) thank_you_header = StreamField( FORM_PAGE_THANK_YOU_HEADER_BLOCKS, null=True, blank=True, max_num=1 ) before_form = StreamField(FORM_PAGE_BEFORE_FORM_BLOCKS, null=True, blank=True) after_form = StreamField(FORM_PAGE_AFTER_FORM_BLOCKS, null=True, blank=True) thank_you_blocks = StreamField(FORM_PAGE_THANK_YOU_BLOCKS, null=True, blank=True) form_title = models.TextField(verbose_name=_("Form title"), default="", blank=True) form_subtitle = RichTextField( verbose_name=_("Form subtitle"), blank=True, features=RICH_TEXT_FEATURES_STANDARD, ) form_submit_button_text_override = models.CharField( max_length=100, blank=True, default="", verbose_name=_("Form submit button text override"), help_text=_("Override the default form submit button text"), ) parent_page_types = [ "wagtailcore.Page", "cms.GenericHomePage", "cms.PlaceholderHomePage", ] subpage_types = ["cms.FormPage", "cms.GenericPage", "cms.BlogOverviewPage"] content_panels = [ FieldPanel("title"), StreamFieldPanel("header"), StreamFieldPanel("before_form", heading=_("Before form")), MultiFieldPanel( [ FieldPanel("form_title"), FieldPanel("form_subtitle"), InlinePanel("form_fields"), FieldPanel("form_submit_button_text_override"), ], heading=_("Form"), ), StreamFieldPanel("after_form", heading=_("After form")), ] thank_you_panels = [ StreamFieldPanel("thank_you_header"), StreamFieldPanel("thank_you_blocks", heading=_("Thank you content")), ] api_fields = [ APIField("header"), APIField("thank_you_header"), APIField("before_form"), APIField("after_form"), APIField("form_title"), APIField("form_subtitle"), APIField("form_submit_button_text_override"), ] submission_panels = [ FormSubmissionsPanel(), ] settings_pannels = ( AbstractPage.settings_panels + AbstractEmailSubscriptionForm.settings_panels ) template = "cms/pages/form.html" edit_handler = TabbedInterface( [ ObjectList(content_panels, heading=_("Form")), ObjectList(thank_you_panels, heading=_("Thank you")), ObjectList(submission_panels, heading=_("Submissions")), ObjectList(AbstractPage.promote_panels, heading=_("Promote")), ObjectList(settings_pannels, heading=_("Settings")), ] ) class Meta: verbose_name = _("Form page") verbose_name_plural = _("Form pages") def get_submission_class(self): return FormPageSubmission ```

comment.body: Can confirm @thibaudcolas's comment after adding a `CheckboxSelectMultiple` widget on a page form, when multiple values are selected, the form is always considered dirty

issue.title: MutationObserver in dirty form check only tests direct desendants

labels.name: status:Unconfirmed
labels.description: Issue, usually a bug, that has not yet been validated as a confirmed problem.

issue.body:
<!--
Found a bug? Please fill out the sections below. 👍
-->

### Issue Summary

I'm in the process of writing a custom widget based on a (very) custom mix of `Chooser` and a Formset-like behavior.
My widget is quite ready and finished but in the process I found something I consider a bug:
 - The form starts being checked 10 seconds after the page being loaded
 - It stores `initialData` and then check every 3sec or 300 or upon keyup or input change
 - It also registers a `MutationObserver` to monitor nodes being removed or added

This lasts one should be triggered by my widget (when adding new lines of inputs for example) but it is not. I'm suggesting the [`validInputNodeInList` check](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/0513a78fb5ec4eb02ef5f602fa182eb885e3c787/client/src/entrypoints/admin/core.js#L158) on added or removed nodes to be inputs (INPUT, TEXTAREA or SELECT) should not only check child nodes but use a `querySelectorAll` instead.

If you consider this a bug, I'm willing to do a PR. In the meantime I'm working around this problem by adding an direct INPUT descendant to trigger the check

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Make a widget that adds a div in an input
2. Wait 10 sec for a form with this widget to load
3. Trigger addition in your widget
4. The unsaved message should appear

Any other relevant information. For example, why do you consider this a bug and what did you expect to happen instead?

-   I have confirmed that this issue can be reproduced as described on a fresh Wagtail project: no

### Technical details

-   Python version: 3.10
-   Django version: 4.2
-   Wagtail version: 5.2rc1
-   Browser version: FF118

comment.body: I think your suggestion makes sense.

### Issue Summary

2. Wait 10 sec for a form with this widget to load
3. Trigger addition in your widget
4. The unsaved message should appear

Any other relevant information. For example, why do you consider this a bug and what did you expect to happen instead?

### Technical details

-   Python version: 3.10
-   Django version: 4.2
-   Wagtail version: 5.2rc1
-   Browser version: FF118

issue.title: MutationObserver in dirty form check only tests direct desendants

labels.name: status:Unconfirmed
labels.description: Issue, usually a bug, that has not yet been validated as a confirmed problem.

issue.body:
<!--
Found a bug? Please fill out the sections below. 👍
-->

### Issue Summary

I'm in the process of writing a custom widget based on a (very) custom mix of `Chooser` and a Formset-like behavior.
My widget is quite ready and finished but in the process I found something I consider a bug:
 - The form starts being checked 10 seconds after the page being loaded
 - It stores `initialData` and then check every 3sec or 300 or upon keyup or input change
 - It also registers a `MutationObserver` to monitor nodes being removed or added

This lasts one should be triggered by my widget (when adding new lines of inputs for example) but it is not. I'm suggesting the [`validInputNodeInList` check](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/0513a78fb5ec4eb02ef5f602fa182eb885e3c787/client/src/entrypoints/admin/core.js#L158) on added or removed nodes to be inputs (INPUT, TEXTAREA or SELECT) but does not check child nodes.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Make a widget that adds a div in an input
2. Wait 10 sec for a form with this widget to load
3. Trigger addition in your widget
4. The unsaved message should appear

Any other relevant information. For example, why do you consider this a bug and what did you expect to happen instead?

-   I have confirmed that this issue can be reproduced as described on a fresh Wagtail project: no

### Technical details

-   Python version: 3.10
-   Django version: 4.2
-   Wagtail version: 5.2rc1
-   Browser version: FF118

issue.title: Image URL generator is confusing for end users
issue.body: ### Issue Summary In its current incarnation, the UI of the image URL generator is not very user friendly. This statement is only based on informal conversations, we haven't done any real user testing, but I think there are specific issues I can point to: - The URL generation happens whenever any of the values change. This can seem like a good thing, but there is no visual indicator that the URL was updated, so it's not immediatly clear that you're supposed to copy the content of the field. This is also the only place within Wagtail that I've seen doing this, so not really consistent with how the UI operates overall. - There is no clear call to action that the URL field is meant to be copied. There should be a message saying "copy the content of this field", or an explicit "Copy" button. - People usually expect to see the result of their manipulation at the end of the form, whereas here it's in the middle. Here is the UI for reference: ### Potential solutions - There should be a clear call to action on this page – in my opinion the best would be to have a "Copy" button next to the URL field. The Google Docs sharing feature is a good example of how this works. - We could make the image panel scroll, so there is no need for the "you may not see the full image" disclaimer. - With the image panel using a fixed max height, we could move the URL field below it where it is the most expected, but still above the "fold". Any further user experience / design direction is very welcome. cc @wagtail/ux-design. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create an image 2. Go to its URL generation form ### Technical details Wagtail 1.10, assuming this is in all versions of Wagtail - JS code: [`image-url-generator.js`](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/0cf3b13a1d54528237552ee37ee2eeb3a13d4e1d/wagtail/wagtailimages/static_src/wagtailimages/js/image-url-generator.js) - Template: [`url_generator.html`](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/0cf3b13a1d54528237552ee37ee2eeb3a13d4e1d/wagtail/wagtailimages/templates/wagtailimages/images/url_generator.html) -------- This is an enhancement, and a nice UI problem to solve. I'll assign myself for now and do further investigation. I think this would be a really good potential PR for a newcomer to the project, but will want to assess this further to be sure. NB: this would also be a good candidate for a rebuild to React.

comment.body: @lb- I will start with Part A. It should easier to tackle and get me in motion with this issue.

issue.title: Upgrade to Node 20
issue.body: Node 20 is now the active LTS, while Node 18 will have security updates until April 2025 it would be good to be on the latest LTS if possible.

issue.title: Wagtail InlinePanel subpanels don't honor "collapsible collapsed"

labels.name: status:Unconfirmed
labels.description: Issue, usually a bug, that has not yet been validated as a confirmed problem.

issue.body:
### Issue Summary

When overriding the `wagtail.admin.panels.InlinePanel` class's child_edit_handler property; the returned MultiFieldPanel does not honor the `collapsed` class in the templates. I'd like to be able to individually collapse the subpanels of the `InlinePanel`; this provides a better overview while not taking up too much screenspace.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Override the panel class like so:
```
class InlineOfficeHoursPanel(InlinePanel):
    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        kwargs["min_num"] = 7
        kwargs["max_num"] = 7
        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)

    @cached_property
    def child_edit_handler(self):
        panels = self.panel_definitions
        child_edit_handler = MultiFieldPanel(panels, heading=self.heading, classname="collapsible collapsed")
        return child_edit_handler.bind_to_model(self.db_field.related_model)

    class BoundPanel(InlinePanel.BoundPanel):
        def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
            super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)
            for index, child in enumerate(self.children):
                child: MultiFieldPanel.BoundPanel

                print(child.classname) # does print "collapsible collapsed".

                ....

```

2. Define the panel on any model with a relationship suited for InlinePanel.
3. Go to the wagtailadmin and look at the panel.

Expected result:
![image](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/assets/91429854/015ad5cd-b7dd-4a21-8723-1a2149d111c6)


Actual results:
![image](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/assets/91429854/479e2e44-5a69-42d8-b4a2-564a6e5dafc7)



#### Any other relevant information.

Though this might not be the conventional way of customising wagtail; it is and remains a Panel. The expectation would be for this to work. Though I don't know how complex logic for this would be; I suspect it would be just as easy as with the `heading` attribute.
Going through the `components/InlinePanel.ts` makes me _think_ more attributes are not supported; but I don't know Typescript all too well; and don't understand the intricacies of how panels are set up all too well.

-   I have confirmed that this issue can be reproduced as described on a fresh Wagtail project: **yes**

### Technical details
-   Wagtail version: 5.1.3

comment.body:
@Nigel2392 I am guessing the custom panels should appear on load of the admin page. Mine is rather blank.

- - This is an example of code - - {% endpanel %} - - {% panel id="help" heading="Help text" %} - -

- Help text is not to be confused with the messages that appear in a banner drop down from the top of the screen. Help text are permanent instructions, visible on every page view, that explain or warn about something. -

- - {% help_block status="info" %} -

This is help text that might be just for information, explaining what happens next, or drawing the user's attention to something they're about to do

-

It could be multiple lines

- {% endhelp_block %} - - {% help_block status="warning" %} - A warning message might be output in cases where a user's action could have serious consequences. - {% endhelp_block %} - - {% help_block status="critical" %} - A critical message would probably be rare, in cases where a particularly brittle or dangerously destructive action could be performed and needs to be warned about. - {% endhelp_block %} - - {% endpanel %} - - {% panel id="listings" heading="Listings" %} - -

issue.title: Image URL generator is confusing for end users
issue.body: ### Issue Summary In its current incarnation, the UI of the image URL generator is not very user friendly. This statement is only based on informal conversations, we haven't done any real user testing, but I think there are specific issues I can point to: - The URL generation happens whenever any of the values change. This can seem like a good thing, but there is no visual indicator that the URL was updated, so it's not immediatly clear that you're supposed to copy the content of the field. This is also the only place within Wagtail that I've seen doing this, so not really consistent with how the UI operates overall. - There is no clear call to action that the URL field is meant to be copied. There should be a message saying "copy the content of this field", or an explicit "Copy" button. - People usually expect to see the result of their manipulation at the end of the form, whereas here it's in the middle. Here is the UI for reference: ### Potential solutions - There should be a clear call to action on this page – in my opinion the best would be to have a "Copy" button next to the URL field. The Google Docs sharing feature is a good example of how this works. - We could make the image panel scroll, so there is no need for the "you may not see the full image" disclaimer. - With the image panel using a fixed max height, we could move the URL field below it where it is the most expected, but still above the "fold". Any further user experience / design direction is very welcome. cc @wagtail/ux-design. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create an image 2. Go to its URL generation form ### Technical details Wagtail 1.10, assuming this is in all versions of Wagtail - JS code: [`image-url-generator.js`](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/0cf3b13a1d54528237552ee37ee2eeb3a13d4e1d/wagtail/wagtailimages/static_src/wagtailimages/js/image-url-generator.js) - Template: [`url_generator.html`](https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/0cf3b13a1d54528237552ee37ee2eeb3a13d4e1d/wagtail/wagtailimages/templates/wagtailimages/images/url_generator.html) -------- This is an enhancement, and a nice UI problem to solve. I'll assign myself for now and do further investigation. I think this would be a really good potential PR for a newcomer to the project, but will want to assess this further to be sure. NB: this would also be a good candidate for a rebuild to React.

comment.body: @Temidayo32 which part? It's probably best to just tackle one at a time.

comment.body:
@codesmith25103  you may want to add a test for this change.

- wagtail/admin/tests/test_edit_handlers.py - see `TestMultipleChooserPanel` - this is more for the panel itself, probably not the view that responds with the checkboxes.
- For the multiple chooser response view, I cannot see that we have a test for this view specifically. It probably needs to go here `wagtail/admin/tests/test_page_chooser.py`. In the class `TestChooserBrowse` a new test that requests with `multiple=1` should get you started.


The view is located in `wagtail/admin/views/chooser.py` (see `BrowseView`) and the URL is set up in `wagtail/admin/urls/__init__.py`.

```py
class TestChooserBrowse(WagtailTestUtils, TestCase):

    @override_settings(USE_THOUSAND_SEPARATOR=True)
    def test_multiple_chooser_view(self):
        response = self.get({"multiple": "1"})  # something like this
        self.assertEqual(response.status_code, 200)
        self.assertTemplateUsed(response, "wagtailadmin/chooser/browse.html")
        # check that the values are correct
        # We may need to add a page that has an id of over 1000
        # we will also need to test this with the setting turned off
        # test data is set in wagtail/test/testapp/fixtures/test.json but we can also add a page on the fly in this test
```

Hopefully that helps as a starting point, a similar test will be needed for the generic multiple chooser but maybe get the page one working first.
